Package ui

Class UI

java.lang.Object
ui.UI
Direct Known Subclasses:
CreditsScreen, LoseScreen, PauseScreen, PlayScreen, SettingsScreen, TitleScreen, WinScreen
public abstract class UI extends Object
Contains the base attributes and methods for each game screen corresponding to each game state. New user interfaces can be created by extending this class.
Author:
Jeffrey Jin (jjj9)

  • Constructor Details

    • UI

      protected UI(GamePanel gp)
      Creates a UI object and links the Settings singleton to this class. Loads the font for the game.
      Parameters:
      gp - GamePanel object that is used to run the game

  • Method Details

    • getHorizontalCenter

      protected int getHorizontalCenter(String text, Graphics2D g2, int screenWidth)
      Centers a string of text in the middle of the provided screen width.
      Parameters:
      text - the text that is to be centered
      g2 - the main graphics object that is used to draw the text onto the screen
      screenWidth - the current width of the screen
      Returns:
      x coordinate for the text you want to draw on the center of the screen

    • moveSelectorUp

      public void moveSelectorUp()
      Moves the selector up on the screen. Prevents the user from moving the selector off the screen by resetting the selector to point to the last item.

    • moveSelectorDown

      public void moveSelectorDown()
      Increases the selector position. Prevents the user from moving the selector off the screen by resetting the selector to point to the first item.

    • getSelectorPosition

      public int getSelectorPosition()
      Returns:
      selector position

    • resetSelectorPosition

      public void resetSelectorPosition()
      Sets selector position back to zero. Shouldbe used everytime the game state is changed.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2)
